subject: Investing
title: How Bonds Differ from Stocks
description: A micro-lesson that makes How Bonds Differ from Stocks usable.

hook.text: Stocks make you an owner who shares in profits. Bonds make you a lender who gets fixed payments.

buildup.text: Stockholders eat last in bankruptcy. Bondholders get paid first. Less reward, more protection.

discovery.text: Stocks have unlimited upside. Bonds cap your return at the coupon rate. The tradeoff is lower volatility.

twist.text: In 2022, both stocks and bonds fell together. The traditional hedge failed when inflation spiked.

climax.text: Most portfolios hold both. Stocks drive growth; bonds provide stability and income.

punchline.text: Stocks are the engine. Bonds are the brakes. You need both.

quiz.question: In a bankruptcy, who gets paid first?
